text: The First Baptist Church in Hardin, Montana, at 524 N. Custer Ave., was built in 1931. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1991. It is a one-story Craftsman style log building. With It was designed by Edelbert Morisette, a French-Canadian, who could communicate the plan only via a model. ==References== Category:Log buildings and structures Category:American Craftsman architecture Category:Baptist churches in Montana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Big Horn County, Montana Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1931 Category:1931 establishments in Montana
title: First Baptist Church (Hardin, Montana)
